meanings.definition: The state or quality of being junior.
meanings.sent1: In our group, the juniority of the new member was evident.
meanings.sent2: She was proud of her juniority in the company.
meanings.sent3: The juniority of the puppy made everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: His juniority in the field was like a fresh breeze.
meanings.sent5: The juniority of the seedling was a symbol of new beginnings.

meanings.definition: The position or status of being younger or lower in rank.
meanings.sent1: Her juniority in the family made her the baby of the group.
meanings.sent2: He worked hard to rise from juniority to a higher position.
meanings.sent3: The juniority of the kitten was clear as it played with a ball of yarn.
meanings.sent4: The juniority of the student council member was a stepping stone to leadership.
meanings.sent5: The juniority of the acorn symbolized potential for growth.

meanings.definition: The period of time during which one is a junior.
meanings.sent1: During her juniority, she learned a lot about teamwork.
meanings.sent2: His juniority in school was a time of exploration and discovery.
meanings.sent3: The juniority of the tadpole was a stage of transformation.
meanings.sent4: The juniority of the caterpillar was a time of preparation for becoming a butterfly.
meanings.sent5: The juniority of the apprentice was a time of learning and growth.
